description: Stopped in before a show at Golden Gate Theater. A great little spot for a nice Italian meal. We had the lasagna special, ravioli and a couple of desserts. They were all flavorful and filling.  The atmosphere is relaxing and the seating is not overly packed. Service was attentive and friendly.
author: Akshay P.

description:
This is a nice and friendly little Italian restaurant in downtown San Francisco. Food is good, you can get several traditional Italian dishes, and the service is also very friendly. 
Prices are not very expensive for downtown San Francisco. And the best thing, this is not a boring chain restaurant...
author: Håkon S.

description: Came back by myself wanted to have a quick snack before the show. Ordered beef carpaccio was so delicious ! I didn't have much time today so didn't order anything else beside that. I'll definitely come back again to try more dishes.
author: Nathalie D.

description:
We found this place on OpenTable and making reservations was easy.

The place is small, but has a great feel and the decor makes it feel like you're in an old school Italian eatery.  

Service was very good, but one thing to note is that there are no kid friendly options.  However, the staff did a fantastic job of working with my son's picky culinary needs and made him something he could actually ingest.  Kudos to them for that.

As for the rest of us, I ordered a stuff chicken breast off the specials menu that tasted delicious.  My wife ordered manicotti and was very happy with it.  We got Creme Brulee for dessert.

Service was on point, food tasted great.  Not much more to say.  I highly recommend this place for some near authentic Italian.
author: Herb D.

description:
This was a great little find as we were looking to grab a bite close to the Masonic before a show. No crowd, great service, very friendly staff. Delicious meals. Gnocchi was very good, Carbonara was delish. Cesar salad tasty and fresh. 
Would definitely recommend. No full bar, just beer and wine, if you care to have a cocktail.
author: Shellie C.

description:
Nice and cozy room, not crowded or busy-like.  Great menu of Italian favorites with quick pleasant service and good food.  I would return
again as I loved the ambience and food.
author: William G.

description:
This place might be ok if you're staying in a hotel in the area and desperately need dinner, but don't expect anything more than mediocre Italian food, at least based on the one visit I made.  

The interior is old school and quaint, with a bar at the front and chianti bottles lining a high shelf all along the walls of the dining room. On a Saturday night when the place was hot and crowded, service was accurate and reasonably attentive, but you could tell they were rushed.

I had a caprese salad with thin, somewhat anemic looking tomato slices, though I liked getting a few thin rings of red onion and two anchovies. 

The veal Marsala with mushrooms had what I'm fairly sure were canned mushrooms and a sweet sauce that tasted more like the brown sauce from a Chinese restaurant than a decent Marsala sauce. There's no way they use any actual real Marsala wine. 

The wines I ordered, a vermentino and a barbera, were poor examples of both, and overpriced for the quality and the size of the pours. 

The dish of vanilla gelato for dessert was the best part of the meal. 

The place was crowded and apparently popular, which I'm afraid I can't account for. I figured San Franciscans had better taste in restaurants. I suspect it's a lot of tourists -- I notice that most of the reviews here are from out of towners.
author: Steve S.

description:
We dropped in for a quick dinner.
Quiet. Lovely. Efficient. 
And, oh the food!
My lasagne bolognese was superb. Many thin layers of fresh pasta napped with an exquisite bolognese...
The leftover serving was just as good, maybe better as breakfast.
author: Kathy B.

description:
This was such a cute restaurant off the busy streets of San Francisco. My hubby and I went for Christmas Eve dinner and it was simply wonderful. 
The homemade gnocchi melted in your mouth. 
The service was good for the busy rush that followed us in. 

The desserts were great too!
author: Lex K.

description: We stopped in for a fast dinner. Was very short 1 - 2 block walk from our JW Marriott hotel. Service was outstanding and the food was very good. Never had a glass reach empty which was nice. Portions were large but not overwhelming , clearly homemade pasta and sauces. Probably closer to 4.5 stars
author: Todd M.

description:
This is probably one of the finest Italian restaurants we have been so far. We went there for a dinner and had a great time, of course at the cost of a big hole in our pocket. 

Food:
We had Bruschetta, Ravioli Di Spinachi, a classic Tiramisu and the Dessert of the day (Cannoli) and none of them disappointed. Bruschetta were good - nothing too facy or overdone but just right. Ravioli Di Spinachi was amazing. Filling was good and the parmesan sauce was brilliant. What blew away our mind was Tiramisu which was absolutely delicious. It is a must try and a disappointment if you're planning Italian desserts and not ordering Tiramisu. Cannoli was good but not so much that it goes into the list of Dessert of the Day. 
Overall, the food was quite above the benchmark but it is quite heavily priced too, so be ready to sign a big check at the end. 

Ambiance: 
The place is a little dark. Perhaps a little more bright light will give it a better feeling. Not much cramped and very comfortable seating - more like restaurants which are meant for fine dining. Given that we went on a weekday night, it wasn't much crowded. 

Service:
The service was good and quick. The food took reasonable time to come. But if you're in a rush, this restaurant is not for you. The staff is good overall - no bad experience as such. 

Overall, if you're in San Francisco, this restaurant is a must try if you want to taste some real good Italian.
author: Jay M.

description: Im surprised that this place doesn't have a better rating because I thought it was fantastic. The menu is a little bit more on the pricey side, but the service is fantastic and works quickly. I got some sort of pasta and it came out hot and tasty. Plus they have complimentary bread which makes this place worth 5 stars alone in my mind
author: Ben P.

description: I'm not sure why this restaurant doesn't have more stars than It does. Everything we had was so fresh and delicious. The service was prompt and the atmosphere was charming. The prices were surprising modest for the area and the portions were generous as well. We will definitely be coming back for another amazing meal.
author: Kris S.

description:
Cute, cozy restaurant with attentive service. The pastas are OK. I tried the farfalle with Gorgonzola, which was good, but not necessarily memorable.
The wine selection is pretty good.
Also, the gelato coffee dessert is a nice way to cap your dinner.
author: Nancy B.

description: Happen chance upon this lil gem around the corner from JW Marriott.  Lobster ravioli, caprese  salad and a DOCG Vermentino.  Excellent dinner!
author: Cheryl H.

description:
What happened here? The food looks and tastes like a frozen food dinner!
I would not recommend.
author: michaela b.

description: My girlfriend and I are from Switzerland, currently spending some days in San Francisco. We traveled quite a lot in Italy and therefore know, how an Italian restaurants may look like. Both of us experienced L'Ottavo as a very nice and authentic Italian restaurant: The service was friendly and the food delicious. Also, the prices were really reasonable for the value we got in return - I would definitely go to L'Ottavo again!
author: Valentin R.

description:
This is my favorite little Italian spot in town. The food is always guaranteed to be delicious and the service is always on point as well. I've come here a few times, both on my own and with a group, and the staff always makes sure to make me feel welcome... they remember everything from where you prefer to sit to your favorite wine. They'll even play around with the menu to cater to what you're craving.. one time I couldn't decide between the Chicken Marsala or a noodle dish, so they created a mixture of the two for me! 
There's really something to be said for authenticity, and L'Ottavo has it. Their food is very classic Italian food, like an old style Italian family type restaurant. 
They also have super authentic desserts that are PERFECTION. Their gelato is seriously so good and well balanced (proportion and flavor profile), and their cannoli special.. not on the regular menu, but it's a dessert special they always run.. super authentic, my favorite cannolis in town! 
Honestly, I regularly think about coming here just to eat cannolis and have a glass of wine.
author: Traci A.

description:
It's only my first time here, but I can't find any fault or issue, so giving 5 stars. We called at 6:26 pm to ask if they had a table for a party of 8 and were offered to reserve a table right away. We reserved for 6:35 and when we arrived we were seated right away. 

Our servers were responsive, accommodating and courteous. The food was very good too. I had a chance to try a few dishes: the Beef Carpaccio, Mixed Salad and the Lasagna Bolognese. All were great. My wife loved her Minestrone soup and for dessert, we enjoyed 3 scoops of Gelato. 

There is another reason that I gave five stars: my wife is sensitive to gluten, which makes it very difficult to eat at Italian restaurants. At this restaurant they offer most pasta dishes with gluten free pasta. The minestrone was sans gluten as well, which was great for my wife. 

Lastly, I'm not sure why so many people gave bad reviews, but our experience was great overall.
author: Paz E.

description: Food was very good but the waitress barely spoke English and no Italian either. As this is an Italian restaurant and not an Asian restaurant, the waitstaff should be able to speak English or even Italian. Food orders were not understood by her and neither was a glass of house Cabernet. We ordered food I hoped we were going to get and pleasantly we did. We tried to order desert and after a while we gave up and asked for assistance from one of the other waitresses. The table near us ended up enlisting help from another waitress as well as we were leaving. All that being said, the food WAS good. If I go back I would make sure not to get that particular waitress. All other waitstaff I observed seemed to know what they were doing and able to convey information to the customers. I'm giving this a 4 star review purely for the restaurant. The waitress alone would warrant a 1 star but I don't feel that's the restaurants fault beyond the one who hired her.
author: Brian G.

description: I slightly understand why this restaurant has 3.5 stars on Yelp. I didn't feel anything super unique about the place, but there's definitely nothing unpleasant about it. The people were nice and the food was good, but nothing special. The room was quite dark and gave off sort of a gloomy feeling. One part that I really did enjoy about L'Ottavo (and the reason it's receiving 4 stars) is the dessert! My family and I shared the Cookies and Cream gelato. Having been to Italy, it was so exciting to taste something so delicious and close to the real Italian dessert. All in all, in the future, I would definitely stop by and give L'Ottavo Ristorante another try.
author: Kaylin O.

description:
So good! All made fresh, nothing pre prepared.
They made me a custom white wine sauce w potato gnocchi and it was perfect! Quiet off the street( not noisy like a few other places that we walked into tonite) and the waitresses were so pleasant. 
 Janny our waitress was so accommodating with my special sauce that I felt like this evening and had the chef make it for me...again it was amazing... like grandma made it! Will return!
author: Patricia G.

description: Just average place. We got stuck at the table squeezed in by the door and bar. We had to get an order to go since my baby was crying. We ordered carbonara...bacon wasn't crispy but was cooked and in big pieces. But it was cooked correctly as there was no scrambled eggs. Also got the penne pasta special with sausage, mushrooms, broccoli with olive oil and garlic. It was good but nothing to really brag about. It was an easy walk from where we were staying since we got into the city so late. I would rather try somewhere new next time.
author: Annie B.

description:
Pros: The food! I had the fusilli al Gorgonzola, and it was amazing! My friend had one of the specials, fettuccine with prosciutto and alfredo sauce, and she loved it. The house white (the not Chardonnay one) was very good--exactly what I wanted in this San Francisco heat wave: cold and crisp. Our water glasses were also never empty!  We got food to go, and they even gave us utensils because they heard that we did not have utensils at the hotel. 

Cons: I can't hold this against them because this isn't common for San Francisco, but no air conditioning in this heat wave isn't ideal.  With the bread, they provide olive oil with balsamic vinegar already added. I prefer having the option of adding balsamic myself. So we got butter instead.
author: Bryant E.

description: This place was amazing, it was so busy and we didn't have a reservation so we sat at the bar which was great the waitress was supper attentive and there food was melt in your mouth delicious, they even gave my daughter a free dessert for her birthday. The Italian wine was delicious and we had a great evening on our first night in town we will be back it is worth the time to check out this place
author: Shaunna S.

description: Nice for dinner. You won't regret ordering The Ravioli Aragosta...Stuffed with lobster in a creamy white wine sauce topped with spinach and bay shrimp. My husband had the veal parm and really liked it as well.
author: Jasmin R.

description: A cozy spot for a great pasta meal. There is something on the menu for everyone. The bruschetta appetizer was enough to share with a table of six. The bolognese sauce was excellent. The service was a bit slow but we did come in at the end of the night when most tables were wrapping up. The waitress suggested a Trebbiano which was delicious with our meal.
author: Carleigh R.

description:
Came to this restaurant with my family. 
The wait staff has to be one of the best to ever serve us. I've don't think we had to ask for anything. They just knew what to bring, water, more bread, fresh grated cheese... they just knew.  As for the food. It was great. Every thing we ordered tasted fresh and hot. The portion size was just right. All four of us were full and the plate had 2 or 3 bites left. If you are ever in San Francisco make it a destination. Plus it's in Union Square.
author: Willam T.

description: Wow.  Really good....really really good.  Great bruschetta, ensalada, chicken "special," tiramisu and wine.  Everyone in our group was happy with their meal. Would highly recommend.
author: Matt C.

description: Ordered on Yelp and pickup was seamless! Pasta was hot and flavorful and generously portioned.  The garlic linguini had just enough kick and the linguini tomato basil was equally great.  Plus, they had a 100 rating from the health department. Would order again for sure.
author: Crissy F.

description: I went here w/ my daughter & got right in.  Great veal & fettuccini!   I'd definitely recommend it for a nice dinner in a casual atmosphere.
author: Tom L.

description: Superb Italian food and excellent service. I had some kind of seafood pasta special with a white wine marinara, and it was one of the best pastas I've ever eaten!
author: Erica F.

description:
Before writing this review I want to say that we ordered from DoorDash and had it delivered. Maybe the food is better if you eat it on location?

For the pasta we ordered the Fettuccine Special and Bolognese. I'll start by saying this was probably hands down, the worst pasta we'd ever eaten. It was horrifically overcooked to mush and the sauce on both dishes were broken.

The fettuccine sauce was completely separated and had a mealy texture, I have no idea how this could have been considered alfredo. It also said it was made with prosciutto but it honestly had the flavor of a dry aged salami. The bolognese barely had any meat in the little sauce that was with pasta. It lacked seasoning, was very bland and acidic.

Along with the pasta we ordered the Bruschetta and Caprese salad. Bruschetta actually wasn't too bad. By far, the best dish of the entire order. The caprese was just, so-so. The cheese had a strange texture and the tomatoes tasted a bit old, they were soft and mealy.

Definitely a pass on this for us next time, at least with delivery. We chose this place specifically because it had so many decent reviews, I wish we'd have gotten to try their food.

$96.00 on 4 menu items for delivery. Fuck that.
author: Seth H.

description: Super solid all around. Taste was on point and service was excellent. The bread was so fresh I'd snort the crumbs off the table.
author: Anne F.

description: We just had a beautiful vacation dinner at this little place not far from Union Square. The interior is cozy, the service friendly and accommodating, and the food? The food is fabulous. We split a Caesar salad and a small assortment of antipasti to start our meal. The wine list is right-sized and decently priced. My friend ordered a crisp Pinot Grigio, and I settled on a soft, plummy Sangiovese. For our dinner, we split an order of fettuccine puttanesca. The house made noodles were perfectly toothsome, silky and tender, the sauce packed with flavor, briny and beautiful. There was plenty to share. We had an unhurried and utterly enjoyable meal, and when we headed back to our hotel, we were well satisfied and our budget hadn't take a beating. Can't recommend this little gem highly enough.
author: Susie M.

description: Great meal here. Ordered the cannelloni with cheese and spinach stuffing and a creamy tomato sauce. Husband ordered the veal. They were both delicious. My complaints are - the bread was sort of meh and the cannelloni was not served as hot as it should have been. Service was excellent. Would come again.
author: Kristie L.

description: Had a great dinner tonight with a group. Service was responsive and friendly. Food was fresh and tasty. A couple of our menu choices were great and a couple were fine.
author: Kimberly L.

description:
Wow! We really got lucky with this one. 
When I'm on the West Coast, the last thing I think of is getting good Italian food. Thanks again to my fellow Yelpers, we tried this one. Plus it's only a few blocks from our hotel. San Fransisco blocks!!! Going back was like a gym workout on the stair master. 
The interior was quaint, dark, and rustic looking. The low archways reminded me of the restaurants in Florence. They had a bar which was key so we ordered a few glasses of Chianti. Pretty good. I ordered some bruschetta for the table, a Caesar salad, and the veal parm from the, "Specials." 
The bruschetta was good although I've never had it served so hot before. It should be cold or warm. The Caesar salad was painfully, "ok." I should have given them my recipe. It's really not hard to make. The veal parm was the star! Pounded nice and thin and fork tender. I didn't need my knife at all. The pasta on the side was also perfectly cooked. Very good marinara too! They said their dessert special was cannolis so I gave it a shot. Well they were really delicious! Three small ones but nicely presented like the rest of their dishes. 
The service was pleasant as well.
I felt that if I lived here, this would be my, "go to" Italian restaurant. Definitely a nice treat being that I'm 3000 miles from home and all of the best Italian restaurants on the planet. Outside of Italy of course.
author: Robert M.

description:
I chose this restaurant because it had been rated as "Quiet," but it is no more or less quiet than any other. There is no separation between the tables, and when the restaurant (which is rather small) is full, with sound bouncing hard walls and floors, you can't have a quiet conversation with your date.

The food is standard Italian-American fare... with no fan-fare. If you like Italian, there's lots of pasta to choose from.
author: Gaston L.

description: Delightful, relatively small place right behind the JW Marriott and just off Union Square.  Lovely homemade pasta.  Great fairly traditional Italian menu.  I had the spaghetti in olive oil with garlic and red pepper flakes and it was very good.  My friend had the chicken parma special and loved it.  We both started with beef carpaccio which was awesome.  A little coconut gelato and an espresso top it off.  And a delightful server to boot.
author: Dave K.

description:
I have to give this place five stars just for the service.

I thought the fettucine with pesto and prawns looked good, but I really wanted gnocchi. Without hesitation, the waitress had the kitchen make me gnocchi with pesto and prawns, even though that isn't an option on the menu.

Oh, and it was DELICIOUS. I will be coming back.
author: Dan D.

description:
Could not have had better service or a better meal. 

I ordered the lobster ravioli, and it was the best Italian dish I've had in a very long time.

Everything was fresh and tasty. I would recommend making a reservation ahead of time!
author: Shay K.

description: We found this place by mistake last night when everything in the neighborhood was booked. It is the best Italian meal we've had in a long time and that means a lot because we are Italian. The ambience is an authentic old-school Italian beautiful lighting great smells great service. We can't say enough about the food the sauces were divine we all have different kinds of pastas and different kind of sauces and they nailed it especially the lasagna Bolognese!  Divine.  Great antipasti and fresh bread with oils.  Hot fresh bread!  Lukas gobbled the gnocchi and said it was perfectly cooked in the pomodoro sauce was perfection. Like grandma Mary's!   Then we of course finished it off with cannoli or perfect crispy shells with the yummy creamy center and fresh pistachio dad on the end and haul it was a nice touch. Loved it you must try it what a gem!
author: Susan A.

description: Great vibe, food/drinks and service! Make sure you check into yelp to get the free yummy chips and salsa!
author: Morgan F.

description: Wonderful classic Italian restaurant! Perfect for a date night with good wine and yummy food. Service was excellent. Our lovely server helped pick out a good wine and recommended some excellent pasta dishes.
author: Shelly D.

description:
My sister and I decided to try this restaurant last night as she is in town visiting and staying in a hotel nearby. We were soo glad we did! The service was amazing, everyone was so attentive and friendly. And the food was outstanding, she ordered the fettuccine special with cream sauce and prosciutto. I ordered the fettuccine with creamy tomato sauce, bacon and mushrooms. They were both outstanding! We almost finished both plates along with an order of bruschetta which was also great. 

We will both definitely be back to eat their delicious food again, until then I'll be day dreaming at work about the delicious food and wine.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Overall - good Italian food and I would eat here again. 

Bruschetta - classic bruschetta with tomatoes basil and Parmesan. Very tasty. Perfect crispy-ness. 

Misto salad - basic, but tasty. 

Cannelloni - sometimes I feel like cannelloni can be too much ricotta and not enough sauce, but not here. Their cannelloni was very well balanced with pasta, cheese, spinach and sauce. Really good.
author: Sheryl T.

description:
Decent italian. L'ottavo pasta (fettucine with bacon, mushroom, and peas in creamy tomato sauce) was quite good, the pasta could be a bit more al dente.

the desserts were the best part of the meal -- chocolate gelato tart (special of the week) was surprisingly delicious. tiramisu was OK.

skip the pasta dish with clam and mussels -- not fresh.
author: Rebecca C.

description: This place was wonderful!! My husband and I are staying at a hotel across the street from this restaurant while visiting San Francisco. We decided to stop in for dinner tonight and I'm so glad we did! My husband had the penne with Italian sausage and I had the gnocchi, which was one of their specials. My husband loved his meal and I was obsessed with my meal!! Lol! The homemade gnocchi was simply outstanding!!! Before the meal, they served bread with oil and balsamic vinegar to dip it in which had little sundried tomatoes in it. It was also very good! And the ambience is just lovely with the dim lighting and the classic Italian music playing. A great dining experience!!
author: Alie K.

description:
I'm sure this is a great restaurant, really, but this was just not one of its best nights.  It was moderately packed when we got there, which probably explains some of it.  We had to wait a few minutes for a table.  That time was spent going over the ample menu, which had a number of promising options. 

We were seated, and our order was quickly taken.  We then spent the next forty-five minutes being ignored while our food took it's sweet time coming out.  After this time had elapsed they brought out our appetizers, which were thankfully excellent, otherwise we would have been fairly angry.  They didn't address us once to apologize or explain the long wait.  

The main course took a further 20 minutes to appear.  Again, the food was very good, but the wait was unacceptable.  What's more, they seemed to have jumbled the sequence of orders, because several folks who ordered after us got their food first.  The busser seemed overwhelmed, though he did an excellent job coping as best he could.  The waitresses were polite, but largely unhelpful.  All in all the experience was not great, and we ended up spending over an hour and a half in the place - too long!

We may consider giving this place another try, but please, step up your game!
author: Lars T.

description: I was in town for work on a Wednesday night and craving Italian. I tried going to Fino (around the corner and closer to my hotel) but was told that it would be at least a 20-30 minute wait and they would only seat me at the bar since I was a party of 1. So I pulled up Yelp on my phone, and I ended up at L'Ottavo, which turned out to be a lovely experience! I had the Pollo Portafoglio - chicken stuffed with pesto, bacon, and spinach in a diced tomato cream sauce - which was absolutely delicious. And the waitstaff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Highly recommended!
author: Katie R.

description: Amazing lobster raviolis. Enough said.
author: Sui N.

description: Great food amazing service wow I was impressed for such a crazy Saturday night still the service was good
author: Sh S.

description: Awesome family dinner. Called 30 minutes before. Scored a great little table at the front of the restaurant. Busy and but busy for a reason! Come eat some great food here!
author: Lee J.

description: My wife & I love this restaurant. Wonderful service, atmosphere and delicious food. The bruschetta is terrific. I love the pesto pasta. Enjoy.
author: Mark M.

description: Came here for my birthday with friends and loved it! The service was great and the food was delicious! It was such a cute space as well!
author: Katie G.

description: Great little Italian restaurant in S.F. I had the special handmade gnocchi in their marinara sauce and it was amazing.
author: Matthew W.

description: I had the fettuccine bolognese and the tiramisu.  The fettuccine bolognese was a little bland for my taste, but pretty good overall.  The pasta was done right and both the pasta and the tiramisu did well for carry-out.  Had to walk four blocks back to my hotel, up to the 21st floor and it was still hot.  Tiramisu was great!  Served with a strawberry on top :)  I'll be back to try another dish soon!
author: Matt E.

description: Steps from our hotel - and a free appetizer of bruschetta with our room key. Gnocchi and ravioli aragosta were both so delicious we had to use our bread to wipe up all the sauce. Split a salad with avocado, mango and strawberries and citrus dressing. YUM!
author: Tracey M.

description: Decent Italian food. Vintage dated atmosphere but cozy place to grab lunch or dinner. A bit pricey but its not crowded and staff is friendly. Tried the Penne Arabiata and the veal. Really tasty! I love their bread, I usually stuff myself with bread and butter at Italian restaurants this place had tasty sweet bread that I could dip in the pasta sauce! The veal was tender and very zesty full of flavor one of the best veal dishes I have had, was surprised to find it in my neighborhood Italian restaurant. Good place to go for a relaxed and casual meal!
author: Maria M.

description: Top quality service and food. Minestrone was very good as was the entrée. I stuck to the special for that evening and it did not disappoint. Really great place that I will return to again.
author: Lee P.

description: Decent Italian restaurant. Small cozy place and gets pack easily. Reservation is highly recommended otherwise you may ended up going somewhere else like the pizzaria next door. Service staff is good and attentive. Food is good and served just like what they said on the menu and not trying to be fancy. Salad are freshly made so as the bruschetta. Pasta are cooked to perfection aldente..and chicken are moist , flavorful and not salty. Deserts are good as well. Nothing fancy  and serve as its described  on the menu.
author: Ron D.

description:
A cosy Italian decor and subdued lighting set an appropriate atmosphere. Our waitress, Claudia, was excellent - friendly, efficient and helpful. The same cannot be said for the manager/owner? who was poorly dressed (even for a casual restaurant), officious and sour.
The meal was delicious and presented well, the service was prompt and the price not unreasonable for a restaurant in this area.
author: Simon K.

description:
It had been a few years since I had been to L'Ottavo.  I had an online deal and it is just down the street from us, so we went one Friday evening.  We enjoyed the assorted antipasti - fresh vegetables, salami, olives.  The bread they brought was quite filling so I tried to hold back, but I think I got too full from it anyway.  

I had the Gamberoni E Capesante (sauteed prawns and scallops in olive oil, garlic, fresh herbs, white wine & lemon), and it was pretty tasty, nothing too mind-blowing but decent.  Although I was quite full, I ate more than half of it and took the rest home.  As leftovers, it is quite tasty mixed in with some red sauce over pasta later.

The best part was the homemade tiramisu, and it did really taste homemade and ooo yum good.  

The food was decent overall, service was a-ok.  Not sure I would rush back to L'Ottavo but for decent Italian food, it is a-ok.
author: Maile N.

description: Hands down the best Italian restaurant in the city. Maybe even the world. I recommend everything on the menu, though I've only ever had one dish.
author: Alex H.

description: Penne is wonderful and despite having 35 people in our group everything turned out awesome.
author: Chris A.

description: This quaint hidden gem was excellent. Both my wife and I had some of the homemade fettuccine and it was delicious and tasted as if it was just made for us. I had the fettuccine L'ottavo and had big pieces of bacon in a delicious creamy tomato sauce. My wife had chicken Romano and she seemed to thoroughly enjoy it as well. They also agreed to do half portions of the pasta for an appetizer even though it's not on the menu to do so. The service was excellent. There seemed to be a mix of locals and tourists. The price is reasonable for quality Italian food. I would recommend and return!!
author: Ryan S.

description: In SF for a mini vacation. Amazing service and food. Great atmosphere. Lovwd it. We had great salad, pasta dishes and lasagna.
author: James B.

description:
Had the lobster ravioli Saturday night and the experience was bad and good. Personally I thought the lighting was a tad dark and made me feel like I had sunglasses on at night. This makes me wonder what they were trying to hide. Although the place wasn't overflowing with people, there was one table of losers behind us who had clearly drank too much, were loud, cursing and drawing attention to themselves. Now I was with a friend so this dinner was by no means supposed to be romantic but it ruined the atmosphere. For this, I blame the staff for not correcting the disgusting party of 6 before they received their $275 bill....hmmmm, maybe that had something to do with it. 

Anyway, the food was good, but nothing to write home about. The accent of the waiter was a nice touch and we were definitely attended to. 

All in all, this place lost a star because of the setting, patron noise & lack of caring by the staff with regard to one terrible table. Hopefully they are more mindful in the future.
author: Shareon S.

description: Quaint place that reminded me of some of my favorite old school spots in Philadelphia and NYC. The food was excellent from top to bottom. I had the veal and it was prepared perfectly. The gnocchi's were great. Service was ok.
author: Jason P.

description: The food here was very disappointing.  We had the lasagna, a penne pasta with meat sauce & a fettuccine Alfredo.  The fettuccine  was the best dish out of the three but the pasta was a bit over cooked.  The penne was al dente but the meat sauce had too much meat and it wasn't tasty.  It reminded me of Chef Boyardee but with lots of meat.  The lasagna was also over cooked and it seemed like it was just lasagna noodles, meat sauce and cheese on top.  No ricotta.  I could be wrong but I didn't see or taste any  ricotta.  The service was very good.  Too bad the food doesn't match up.  No wonder this place was empty.
author: Tricia K.

description: My wife and I are visiting from Australia, we do like our Italian food and thought we would try these guys out. They were very friendly the food was nice and well presented and served in a timely fashion the wine was good and reasonably priced The place had a great feel and very relaxed i have no problem recommending any body to dine here!
author: Rick O.

description: Quick decision for lunch during a conference. Wonderful menu, great food and friendly staff. Serves beer and wine!
author: CaliFinfan B.

description: Friendly and professional staff. Had the lobster ravioli and it was outstanding. Prices was fair for the quality.
author: Lars K.

description: We took a recommendation from our tour bus driver and it is a really nice place.  Tucked into a little location is a bit deceiving.   We started with the tomato bruchetta which was very nice.  I had the veal with a side of linguine pasta with bolagnese sauce and my wife had the lasagna.   Both were exceptionally tasty.  Very nice find.
author: Bryant S.

description: Fair at best. I visited while on a business trip... It was Friday night at 8 pm and this was the only place nearby with a couple of open tables (perhaps indicative that it's not among the better choices). Service was fine though unremarkable.  Food was not really disappointing but also did not impress.  Very average... Crab bisque was good.  Lobster ravioli was fair.  They overcook the pasta a bit. The white sauce was watery.  Price per person is about $40-45 so certainly not upscale by standards of this area for Italian dining. But I think one could spend not too much more for a much more memorable meal elsewhere. I wouldn't go back unless in a pinch.
author: Rick C.

description: Love, love this adorable neighborhood place! Can't believe I never reviewed this before! Everything is delicious!!! The current owner took over a few years ago and the smart lady she is, didn't change a thing. Food is authentic and filling! Great prices. I've taken probably over 100 people there in the years I've been going. Everyone loves and every time they visit want to go back. Great food. Seriously.
author: Traci H.

description:
Any time I have friends in town we inevitably get sucked in to the Union Square area famished from shopping. 

L'Ottavo is a such a great escape from your tourist trap chain restaurants and it's nice and dark so you can have a relaxing, quality meal. 

I've been there 3 times over the years and every time I think, "I really like this place." I get the eggplant chicken pasta and every time I'm happy as can be.
author: Desiree P.

description:
non è molto buono.. 

Bruschetta: watery tomatoes and even with parmesan on top it was tasteless. 

Eggplant al forno was pretty bad; uncooked and soupy so just don't put yourself through that.

The Bistecca quality was not good and the side potatoes (3 slices of a potato) were cold and tasteless.

One star for great service and decent lobster bisque.
author: Sabrina J.

description: Awful awful food, i dont know why they have such raving reviews, the food taste was just terrible.... The starter was salmon carparccio, which was dosed in lemon and not edible, the main was marsala sauce which didnt come close to a traditional marsala sauce. The chef needs another job,the most horrible italian food i have ever eaten. Service was good and the desserts were good.
author: Prabhash S.

description: Nice Italian restaurant with great ambiance. All the employees were friendly and efficient. The food didn't disappoint either. The homemade tiramisu is delicious, best I've had. We would definitely come back.
author: Donna T.

description: It was reasonable food with good flavor.  Dishes were not salty or strong. My wife liked their risotto.
author: K P.

description:
The ambiance and the wait staff were OK. The food was not. I had a dish with steak, shrimp, sausage and chicken in a tomato sauce. The steak was good, as was chicken. The bad part was that the sauce - it tasked almost like out of a can. 

When we walked in I immediately noticed the silence... No music
author: B G.

description:
L'Ottavo is an Italian restaurant near Union square that has space when others don't, and a cosy atmosphere to boot. The food is good, although a bit on the expensive side (but this is in the center of San Francisco, so to be expected). Convenient for a meal before or after a theater performance (e.g. at ACT).

Good for kids in that the servers were helpful and accommodating, but there was no kids menu (they split a standard pasta dish in two for the two kids at our table).
author: Larry P.

description:
One night while staying at Marine Memorial hotel just right down the street from here we we're craving Italian food so we yelped a few spots and stumbled upon this little place. We made reservations just 2 hours before and got a seat 30 minutes before our reservation time.

The place was easy to find, the staff were sweet and the place was nice and cozy...a bit dim but most Italian restaurants usually are. Our waiter was really enthusiastic and helpful. A friend ordered the L'Ottavo, another friend ordered a seafood dish with marinara sauce and I ordered a chicken and eggplant dish with marinara and lots of chili pepper flake...I've come to LOVE Italian food over this year and being that I ate everything from my plate already means I loved it and so did my girlfriends because we inhaled everything on our plate. Price is a bit pricey but who cares when your on vacation right??!!
author: Raych D.

description: Nice little Italian restaurant with a great atmosphere. Very friendly service. Only problems were there was a hair found on one of our plates and the food took a little longer than expected. Overall a good restaurant. A must have is the Minestrone soup. Delicious!
author: Nathan G.

description: Enjoyed my time and meal.  I went on  a Tuesday evening.  Wasn't too busy,  and the guests there seemed to enjoy themselves.  Our server was very friendly.  I would recommend this place.
author: Jer M.

description:
Cute little Italian restaurant downtown. Wasn't very happening (not busy and mostly older folks having casual dinner), but the food was great. The lobster ravioli was a stand-out, and the Charcuterie plate was generously filled.

Our waiter was a bit on the snooty side, though. I don't go out to Italian very often, but the waiters are more often than not a bit on the snobbish side. I don't get it.

Never the less, the food was great.
author: Katie S.

description:
This place is bomb! I came here with my family for dinner and we had an excellent experience. I ordered the crab bisque and the lobster ravioli, both were divine. The ravioli was clearly homemade, and my mom confirmed this since she often makes ravioli from scratch as well. 

They have a bunch of great wines to choose from as well and the service was fantastic. Quick, efficient, and incredibly professional.  The restaurant also has a nice, elegant, romantic ambiance. If you're looking for good Italian food downtown that's not too expensive, this is the place. Our entree plates ranged in price from $18-$25.
author: Zoe S.

description: Our food was delicious. Lobster ravioli is a must. Service was a bit slow but not bad.
author: Kitana G.

description:
There were six of us for  dinner here on Friday Oct 10.  We were beginning our Fleet Week / Columbus Day weekend.  It was a last minute decision to go here but they sat us almost immediately.

This is a quaint little restaurant.  Our server was NAT and she was such a cheerful person, always smiling and such a friendly girl.  The food was delicious.  Service was wonderful.  Even our water glasses were kept full 

Nice restaurant that I will frequent again when we are in the area.
author: Betty S.

description:
Seriously delicious veal saltimbocca, chicken w madeira and mushrooms.Wines were very good for a middle of the road northern Italian place and yes, it was noisy as hell and the waitress was attractive slightly attentive and unavailable most of the time. 

I thoroughly enjoyed the food, the crowd and the meal.

No complaints for $80 for two.
author: Bill E.

description: Food was incredibly overpriced for the quality. Our meal was okay but nothing fantastic standard fettuccine with nothing special sauce could have come from a rage can and I wouldn't have noticed a difference...
author: Michelle K.

description: I've been here 3 times or so... Every time i've had so far has been good. However I heard from the staff that the thing to try is the lasagna. Next visit to the Bay Area I will be there!
author: JB W.

description: Extremely happy with the pastas we ordered. So tasty. The service was great, very lovely people. Nice setting. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience.
author: Bek S.

description: OVERPRICED but tasty food.  The lasagna was nice, good balance of meat, sauce, noodle and cheese, but $20 was double what it was worth.  Crab bisque was nice, good flavor. Now for the bad.  The bread appeared to be SEVERAL days old, dry and flavorless.  Their wasn't enough dipping sauce to moisten it up, but it worked okay as croutons for my soup.  The hazelnut gelato tasted chemical not good and the meal upset my stomach.  We did ask if they give a locals discount since it is a tourist place.  They did give us 10% off but the bill for the four of us was $200 for pasta, and that was with sharing a starter and dessert. Don't think we will be back.
author: Jerry W.

description: Excellent food! Wonderful service. Will for sure be back here. The portions were perfect and the taste was wonderful. Music and ambiance completed the whole package.
author: Jennifer E.

description:
Recently discovered the delicious grilled eggplant and tomato appetizer (can't remember the name) and have gone back several times since to repeat the experience.
Friendly bar staff and charming old decor.
author: G Q.

description:
Very Cozy and warm environment is the feeling when you enter through the door. It was a Saturday, and the place was packed. On top of that, we were a party of nine. We hung out at the bar drinking wine till we waited for the rest of our party, and our table was already ready. BTW, really good selection of wine from Italy and California.

Very friendly staff, and very attentive. Our orders took a bit, but as I said we were a party of nine. They sent us complementary Bruschetta, Bruschetta Con Melanzane E Peperonata and Melanzane Al Forno... hm hm hm (insert Homer drooling sounds here). 

Most of us ordered the Linguine Pescatore, it was the special of the day... it was delicious and of course the seafood was fresh (but I don't expect any less eating in SF). Somebody else ordered another special the Penne Pollo, no complains either.

Three people from our party ordered something from the regular menu. The Salmone Alla Livornese, a bit salty for her taste. The Fettuccine Con Gamberi, she said it was overcook but the dill sauce was exquisite. And my husband ordered the lasagna knowing is a hard plate to prepare cause of time, he took the risk. He said it was good but not great.

My husband and I have been in Italy. We got tourist trapped in Rome restaurants, and this place was by far better tasty and authentic.
author: Cela V.

description: Came here on a Saturday night early and had no wait. However, it seemed to pile up after us. The crab bisque was very good. I enjoyed the Cesar salad, but found no evidence of anchovies. Bummer. I shared the gnocchi pomodoro with my husband. Ok, but not what I was hoping for. Lacked the fresh tomato taste. Still good, though. The wait staff was great, hustled and answered all of our questions.
author: Kym S.

description: It was a pretty decent dining experience. The staff was friendly. Interesting that an Asian staff is running an Italian restaurant, but the food was really pretty good.
author: Loni B.

description: Awful. Stay away. The reviews on Open Table are misleading. The wine selection for wine by the glass are awful. I'm almost positive they buy their meat from Ralph's.
author: John E.

description: Neighbors invited us here. Happy to know about this place because it's not far from our home. Service was excellent. Loved my veal parmesan.
author: Paula H.

description: I don't know how the food is but this review is based on the service. We called and made a reservation, showed up and were told a few minutes. A group of people came in after us they did not have a reservation and were seated before us. We sat there for 30 minutes before we got up and left.
author: Andrew B.

description: Meh. A little pricey for portions that border on being too small and taste that isn't that mmmm-inducing. Plus they don't validate for parking so good luck with that ridiculous SF street parking unless you want to pay $3/20 minutes in the structure across the street.
author: Kathy L.

description: Wandered in here when our pre-chosen Italian place was full. The lasagna was amazing. Probably the best I've had. But the seafood pasta special was less than mediocre. The mussels and clams were not fresh and some actually gritty. Great service. We were quickly served on a Friday night. Crab bisque was yummy.
author: Amanda M.

description: Ok., I'm Italian and the food was a four and that is for the stars.......but please, everyone from the waitress to the bartender correspond in Spanish. Kinda annoying.  Restaurant was stuffy but my husband had them open the door.
author: Gazelle P.

description: We had the Spinach and Lobster Ravioli. The were both good. Very Average when compared to other similar dishes I've had at other restaurants. We had a good salad with mangoes, avocados and other fresh vegetables.  I really like the intimate feeling of this restaurant. It was darker and I like looking at the wine bottles that were all over the restaurant. Located very close (a few blocks) to Union Square. It was a little pricey about 20 dollars a plate. Did I get a good value? Probably not although I will probably will return and try something else that could impress me.
author: Jeff C.

description:
I was here wednesday night. The service it is a little fast for this type of restaurant, I think because the staff are asian. ( some of them work like that) Besides that the two Asian ladies were speaking their language near the bar, it was a bit annoying for a italian restaurant.  But the food was good.

The 3 stars is for the food.
author: Patrick P.

description:
Intimate and adorable.  Yelp did not steer me wrong.

We were staying in Union Square and wanted tasty italian without going North Beach or my favorite spot of Nob Hill Cafe, and I came across this place.  It was tiny and adorable, everything I needed for a relaxed and casual evening in SF.

The place is intimate and warm.  It had a little "Old Italy"-ness about that I hope is authentic, but it had a little franchise-esque ness about it too.  Either way it worked.  They had Sinatra on, I was a happy camper.

- Mushroom Bruschetta: On special, it was lovely and careful.  A nice twist compared to the usual tomato concoction. 
- Classic fettuccuni bolagnese was tasty and spicy. The pasta is clearly fresh and could be easily convinced its made on the premises.  The sauce was tasty, and felt like it was marinating all day to its goodness. Perfection!
- Seafood ravioli in a white wine cream sauce was delectable, as my diner inhaled it to its delight!
- Desserts! Spumoni was classic, but go for the Almond Coffee Gelato Cake! Simply to die for.  Literally, perfect night cap of utter sweetness and a little coffee taste! The best!

Service was attentive and respectful.  Nothing too much and nothing too little.  Crowd was a date night kinda place or a relaxed adult family kinda vibe too.

Among the crap restaurants that seem to linger in this area, this is a little gem and well priced too.
author: Natalie G.

description: I wish I would have taken a picture of our 'Caesar salad' and lasagna bolognese.  Both were just awful.  We took a few bites because we were so hungry and that was it.  I told the server, which smart sense would have known with two full salad and entree plates, that something was off.  Not here! Can NOT recommend the food.  As for my stomach the rest of the night......gurgled.
author: Toni E.

description:
Holy Moly! I haven't had Italian food this good in years.  My girlfriend and I went here on a whim and literally didn't stop eating or talking about how good the food was until the food was gone and the check had arrived.

GO HERE ASAP IF YOU WANT GREAT ITALIAN!
author: D D.

description: A group of friends and I were staying at a hotel on Sutter Street and were craving Italian food that was close by.  Decided to make a reservation for L'Ottavo.  We actually arrived 30 minutes earlier to our reservation time, and they graciously accepted us anyway.  GREAT! I ordered the L'Ottavo which consisted of bacon, sweet peas, mushrooms in a light tomato sauce.  I usually would prefer white alfredo sauce because some Italian serve too much tomatoes in their sauce.  But the L'Ottavo had a creamier consistency of tomato sauce that was absolutely to die for!!! I ate it all!!!!! Only set back was the price, but I guess you get what you pay for, which is fine with me.  Left with a happy belly ^_^
author: Chelsea G.

description:
Came here with Sam S one night after work looking for a nice dinner to celebrate our new SF scene.  What we found was super tasty pasta, a calm atmosphere, and efficient service. 

Granted, the prices are a little steep, but it's to be expected in this area.  I had the linguine carbonara and it was so good!  Little plump peas, delightfully creamy sauce, and crispy bacon. Yum. We shared a half carafe of the house white wine and were surprisingly pleased with it for only $15. Sam S loved his pasta as well, and ate every bite!

Bottom line: For a nice dinner close to my office, I'd chose L'Ottavo.
author: Kellie T.

description: We popped into this place unexpectedly (and last minute) on a Saturday night while in town for vacation. We are from Philadelphia and are no strangers to good food, but this was simply fantastic. Everything was so fresh and so wonderfully balanced, we were blown away! This place was amazing-the ambience, the food, the waitstaff- amazing. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a great tasting casual Italian dinner.....
author: Fred R.

description:
WORST EXPERIENCE. Food was mediocre, service was slow, impersonal and adequate at best. Couldn't get water refilled or more bread.
We had a party of 5 and were forced to pay OVER 20% gratuity for this terrible service??
They even wrote in the tip THEMSELVES for the credit card receipt.

Go anywhere else and save yourself the trouble. You could easily have the same experience staying at home with a jar of Ragu.
author: Ping G.

description: We were hoping for a nice early romantic Italian Dinner experience prior to attending a play.  Reading through the reviews we were expecting more.  The food was nice enough, but nothing really special, and, the wine & beer choices were not the greatest.   We arrived at 6:00 PM with Open Table reservations, and were directed to a table in the back by the kitchen door.  The restaurant was quite full with the exception of two large tables being held for large parties of 8 - 10.  We therefore opted to sit at their small bar that had five bar stools.  Incidentally I would like to mention that the two large empty tables remained empty until we left.  In all fairness, I will say that the spinach salad was quite good.  I had pasta, and my husband had the grilled chicken breast.  It was just a bit weird to us that not one of the waitpersons was Italian.  Too bad, it was a cute restaurant.
author: MandL C.

description: Not a bad little restaurant. Very neighborhood-y type of place. Kinda touristy. Still good food and service. You are near some very high end places so this is not bad. Nice ambiance. Wont totally kill the pocketbook. Not a destination place but great as a secret hole-in-the-way place.
author: Jeff D.

description: Nice meals. Excellent presentation. Waiters really kind and willing to help you in anyway. One of the best italian restaurant in union square for sure. Prices are the only negative point, maybe thy are a bit too high but in general it is worth it to have a good dinner there. Buon appetito!
author: Alex F.

description:
Found this place wandering around my daughter's new neighborhood.  We were in the mood for Italian and stopped in here.  Surprised it wasn't busier on a Thursday evening, but nice to be seated right away.  House Chianti was very good - followed with special summer salad with strawberries and mangos on greens with avocado and citrus vinegarette.  I ate all of it and didn't want to share.  Then the special Lasagna Bolognese, amazing!  My daughter had the bruchetta, excellent, and the prawns and scallops in an herbed white wine sauce with vegetables - also amazing!  And finally, the Tiramisu which is made here - wow!  We shared but I could have had one of my own for sure.  Portions are good sized, not too much, not too little.  Prices are fair for SF.  All in all, a great dinner and we're both looking forward to going back.

I don't know what some of these people who gave it less than 3 stars were expecting, the setting is charming, the service is acceptable, and the food was really delicious.  I didn't expect valet parking or validated parking here.  Maybe going in with a good attitude had something to do with my experience?
author: Corinne C.

description: At the suggestion of the main desk at the Hilton I went to L'ottavo.  I needed to have Italian before heading back East.  Usually I go up to North Beach but was running out of time.  This is a jewel very cozy and friendly atmosphere.  I had the mussels and clams over linguine.  Outstanding.  Nice portions and great value.  Every plate that went by look a delicious as mine tasted.  You cannot miss with this one.  Jenn is the bar keep and a very nice friendly person.  I will be back for seconds.
author: Kevin L.

description: Pricey, not authentic, rubbery Veal. They get 2 stars for atmosphere-quaint, romantic.
author: Staci R.

description: We were very pleased with the restaurant and will seek it out, when we return to San Francisco.  The service was great, the ambiance was good, but the food will keep up coming back.
author: Jane M.

description:
This place was also recommended to a friend an I by the concierge at the Hilton. We both agreed that it was an excellent recommendation and we even went back there for dinner again a couple of days later.

The pasta has a home made taste to it and the sauce wasn't too creamy nor too watery, just perfect.  I also liked the cozy romantic candlelit atmosphere. 

The only issue I had was with the service being slightly unattentive but I think they were low on staff the times I visited. 

I don't remember it being expensive either. A glass of wine and a plate of pasta cost me around $25 excluding tip.

I don't know if there's parking anywhere you'll probably have to do some walking to get here.
author: Kathy S.

description: Deleting previous review.  Wasn't able to eat there due to kitchen issue, but prompt customer device with a personal phone call explaining the situation was greatly appreciated in dealing with the cancelled reservation.
author: Brian H.

description: Tasty, reasonably priced, Italian. Very nice crew. The pesto fettuccine with shrimp was awesome!
author: Nolan E.

description: I'd come back. small & cozy. fettuccine carbonara is amazing.
author: Allie V.

description: My husband and I enjoyed the the atmosphere in the restaurant tonight.  The Caesar salad was not as expected since it included artichokes and olives, though the dressing was surprisingly delicious.  They even switched out the pasta, which was penne, for fettuccine.
author: Angela S.

description: A small, Italian trattoria with the warmth those words suggest. Everything tasted homemade - I had the lobster stuffed ravioli and they were awesome! Would definitely make a return visit when in the mood for Italian! Make reservations to make sure there is room when you want to go.
author: Randy A.

description:
3.5 really but you know how it goes. 

The parental units got a hotel by union square and wanted to take us all out. Well all the brothers can be a bit much to feed so we didn't want to go anywhere with million dollar micro plates. We decided to go for a walk. 

The concierge directed us to a fairly stark chinese restaurant. We all stared at the blindingly bright interior and decided it was not going to host the family dinner we were after. So we turned around a bit, saw some twinkley lights and walked towards them. 

Our group of 7 was promptly seated and a round of drinks ensued. We got some bread and beers. Not bad, not bad. Ordered some appetizers. The bruschettas were yummy. We really enjoyed the clams and mussels special. Lots of mussels and a nice, light tomato garlic sauce which was awesome with the bread. 

The menu was pretty straight forward. I ended up getting the chicken bruna. It is basically chicken marsala but the sauce was reduced to a glazed and tasted better than any of my attempts at home. The lobster ravioli was a hit, 3 people at our table got it. Pops got the lasagna and he was a happy man. 

The food is good. Not phenomenal but not offensive. The service was fine for us and our waiter made sure we were well supplied. They kept the beers coming and were good about picking up the many dishes we generated. The carafe of water was left at the table which, as wasteful as it is, I like because I am a big girl and can pour my own water when I am thirsty. I drink a lot of water so perhaps this is not a quality that others will appreciate. I did. We lingered over dinner and it did take a bit to get the entrees but with good company who really cares? 

I don't think I would make a special trip over to the madness of Union Square just for this place but I will keep it on the radar for other visitors.
author: colleen b.

description: Went here for my anniversary. I had the Lasagna and my boyfriend had the lobster ravioli. We both decided mine was the better one, but his was really good too. The service was great! My only complaint was I thought this was going to be a romantic setting, but there was a table of 6 by us of teenage boys making a bunch of noise. But we ignored them and still were able to enjoy ourselves!
author: Marie E.

description: Not bad. 3 stars because it is a little pricey for what you get. But I wouldn't dissuade you from dining here. It's perfectly good Italian food.
author: Vol T.

description:
A few years ago, I was visiting San Fran with a friend and we just happened upon this little spot near our hotel. We have returned to L'Ottavo every trip since then.

This place is fantastic. The wine list is great, and I have never had a dish I didn't enjoy. Everything is made fresh, which attributes to the sometimes slow service. But the food makes up for it. I would recommend the Linguine Pescatore or the Lobster Ravioli. Both are impeccable dishes with excellent portion sizes.

Although small, the interior is warm and cozy. Perfect for intimate dinners, but not bad for a small group either. I would highly recommend.
author: Emily S.

description: We came for dinner at 6pm on a Friday night.  The restaurant was about 50% full.  We arrived  about 40min earlier then our reservation.  The staff did seat us right away and was accommodating.  All and all, the service was prompt and accommodating.  The decor seemed cozy and intimate.  Though my bf thought the old carpet needed to renew(faint lingering musty smell).  I ordered the steak but 2 bites into it I realized that more than half of the portion of the steak was all fat.  Not very good meat quality at all.  I was turned off from the meal and just skipped the dessert.  Not in a hurry to return anytime soon.
author: thuy n.

description:
This place has a cozy neighborhood feel. I found the service to be very good. We weren't rushed and the server quickly corrected our order when she found out we were prepared the wrong appetizer. 

I had the special, lobster ravioli in a champagne cream sauce, while my dining partner had a veal and mushroom dish. The main courses were above average but not outstanding--the menu descriptions made the dishes seem tastier than they really were. The salmon carpaccio appetizer and tiramisu desert, however, were delicious and the 2003 Masi red wine that we chose from the menu complimented the meal well. 

I'll be back again, because I live close, but I wouldn't travel across town for this spot.
author: Chris S.

description: Average food; tacky decor, and a super noisy environment, in short, the perfect storm for a tourist trap. There are plenty of better Italian places to eat but if you're completely exhausted from your travels, and it's late at night, and you're starving, then this food will pass for Italian. If you're using Yelp, and I know you are  ;-),  keeping using your "around me" feature to look for better places.
author: Tracy P.

description: It was just o.k. I wouldn't recommend it if there was another italian restaurant nearby.  I didn't like the atmosphere....indoor outdoor rug, old furniture, no bar, plastic flowers.....you get the picture.  However, saying that I ordered the pasta carbonara that was done perfect.  My daughter had the chicken Marsala and again she ate it all, so if ambience isn't part of what you are looking for I'd recommend it.
author: Mary D.

description: Nice small cozy place a couple of blocks from Union Square. We were a group of 3 people and had a reservation. The ambiance was OK, food and service was good but the place was way too noisy (sunday evening). It was really hard to hear each other, I would prefer a more quiet place.
author: Kush S.

description:
Stumbled in after an afternoon of power shopping around Union Square.  It was barely after their 5 PM opening so we were their first guests of the night.  Buona sera! greets us as we enter the dimly lit dining room.  While the atmosphere is cozy and some might consider it romantic, it was almost too dark and too quiet for our tastes.  We were happy to see the crowd file in and add some life to the restaurant.  

The food:    They served the olive oil with some sundried tomatoes..very tasty, but we resisted the urge to fill up on bread.   She tried a prawn fettucini dish in a white cream sauce.  I also went for fettucini, but mine was accompanied with roasted eggplant and chicken in a light tomato sauce.  Mine was good and my wife was very complimentary as well.  As we always do, we capped off the meal with tiramisu.  We were definitely full but didn't  feel overstuffed, 

Overall, the atmosphere was nice and the food was above average.
author: Ron G.

description: Great ambience, cozy and pretty. Good and fast service too. But the food isn't worth the money. Its just average. Each entree is an average of $20.
author: Sofi H.

description:
I don't understand the mixed reviews...Yes, it's touristy, but I really like this place for several reasons...

Romantic Ambiance: Soft lighting with garlic hanging off vines accompanied by bottles of wine situated everywhere...nice touch! 

Wine: The bottle of Chianti was amazing and paired perfectly with our meals.

For my entree, I initially wanted to find out what all the excitement was about the lasagna, but upon finding that it would take an extra 20 mins wait, I instantly went with my second choice the L'Ottavo.  C'mon, bacon, mushrooms, creamy sauce and fettuccini?  Drool.  

Overall, however...the service is kind of lacking.  Just don't come here super hungry...
author: Jennifer L.

description:
So I went there with 2 friends after a day of shooting and we were STARVING. 
The place is nice, I don't like the tables, but it's a detail I guess. 
The food is good. And I can tell bc I am italian, and lived there for 22 out of 24 years so I know what I am talking about. 
We had stuff from their specials menu and the Melanzane Alla Parmigiana. Those were good but they weren't what it was supposed to be. 
We had: Linguini with SeaFood.. Good
Pappardelle w/ mushroom --- SUPER GOOD
and a meat plact, i dont remember the name, but basically was a layer of veil, a layer of chicken, a layer of mozzarella. SO GOOOOD. to me it tasted like HOME.

I definitely suggest this place. it's not a 4 stars for me simply bc I think it's overpriced for what they serve. I could have made any of those plates at home by myself. but the food is good, and most important, it's truly italian.
author: Elena A.

description:
It was the ultimate Friday night, post-event conundrum: Risk eating in Union Square because we are starving or head to a less touristy part of town for something we know is good? We chose option A, and failed.

Stopped in this spot because we knew we could get a seat right away. Well, there's a reason, and that reason is because this place is awful. It is cliche as all get out, with the most generic decor imaginable. It's close enough to the hotel district to stay alive, but should be put out of its misery ASAP. 

Does anyone love this place and desperately can't wait to get back? Doubtful. This place exists solely on trickle-in tourism, and so they have no incentive to give good service. Repeat customers are few and far between, no doubt, so your server isn't going to give two shits, I assure you.

It took a good 15 minutes for anyone to greet us despite the fact that the place was virtually empty. When he did arrive all he muttered was, "ready to order?" I got a chicken dish with what he called "potatoes and vegetables" (no more specific than that), and the boyfriend got seafood pasta. The food was serviceable, but horribly overpriced. I got, literally, one and a half small new potatoes and a pittance of carrots and peppers. The food was actually tasty, which is what saved this review from one stardom, but still, you should not go here. We watched a poor couple clearly from out of town have an increasingly awful experience as the night wore on. I wanted to apologize to them on behalf of all of San Francisco. "We do have great dining experiences, just not here!"

Don't go slumming in this place, even if you are so hungry you might die. You can do much, much better.
author: Brittney G.

description: Not bad for what it is. I had the fetuchinni alfredo which was good but a little on the small side. Another person had cantaloni which was really good, someone else had lasagna which was delicious. My sisters had pasta with bolognese sauce which tasted like hot ass. The resturant had a really uncomfortable feel to it to the point where I didnt want to leave my table. 3 stars for the food and 1.5 stars for the ambiance.
author: Dylan H.

description: Small restaurant, nice and cozy. We LOVED our waitress. The food was excellent, specifcally the homemade Lasagna. Yum!
author: Marsi E.

description:
Not bad at all.  A cozy little spot.
The staff is not Italian but the recipes sure are.
Good service. Good flavors (especially the sauces). 
They have been doing this for a while...and it shows.
Much better than expected, considering they are so close to Union square and the convention/tourist hotels.
author: Dave M.

description: Stumbled on this spot on new year's after giving up hope of finding an open italian restaurant in the area. Very pleasantly surprised!!! crab bisque, cannelloni, and tiramisu were all notable!
author: Julie P.

description: This place is cute but underwhelming. I dined here twice, 1st time was just ok so I decided to give it one more shot. The service and ambience are good but the food is boring and bland. It comes out and looks good but it has ZERO flavor. I make better pasta at home and for alot less money. I wanted to like this place but there's nothing to really like.
author: Kimberly R.

description:
I'm definitely leaning towards 3.5 but ya know, politics. Anyway.
The man and I were walking the cold rainy streets of San Fran looking for a place to eat so we figured this place looked cute so why not!

This place is really cute and quaint, candles and soft lighting, that kind of thing. We looked over the menu and decided to start off with a glass of wine. We asked the server what he thought and he said the house red was good so we went with that. The bf decided to order the spinach ravioli and I ordered baked chicken with some type of marinara sauce. Once we got our wine we thought it was kinda average, nothing amazing. Our food was good though, once again nothing amazing, but it got the job done. The service was a little slow, but luckily everything came out good.

Now here's the reason you come to this place, if for no other reason, come here for the Tiramisu! OMG that stuff freakin melts in your mouth! I think we polished of the plate before the server even walked away! I will come back here just for that alone!!!
author: Ashley M.

description: Went here searching for Italian food near the hotel after the long drive.  We arrived around two hours prior to closing on a Friday night, yet there was only one waiter serving the whole restaurant and towards the end of our dinner they were closing up around us.  The food wasn't terrible, but I've had Italian at many other places that did a better job.  I ordered the fettuccine alfredo, and although it was really salty, it was edible.  The restaurant itself was also very loud and cramped, which I'm not a fan of.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Hungry?  On a date?  Eat L'Ottavo's == score.

I stopped in while aimlessly wandering the streets of San Francisco one evening.  The place is small but very quaint and the atmosphere (quiet jazz piano, dim lighting, delicious aromas) was very inviting.  I ordered a bottle of some Bardolino wine and the 'on special' lasagna Bolognese.  They bake the lasagna fresh so it takes a while but you have great wine and bread to sample as you relax and unwind.  The Bolognese ragu perfectly complemented the meaty lasagna and the portion was just the right size.  The price (considering you are in San Francisco) was agreeable.  

I have eaten in many fine (and not so fine) Italian restaurants and can't award this a full on '5', but it really deserves a solid 4.5, at least for my initial and only sampling of the joint.

I will stop in again.
author: Justin B.

description: A REQUIRED 20% TIP????? The restaurant is terribly lit, with horrible service (did not get water or bread refilled) , a below average food quality (pastas were too dry and salty) and the waitress did not ever mention a required 20% gratuity for a party of 5 at all. We did not see it written anywhere on the menu either so imagine our surprise when we got the receipt! Overall horrible experience and will not be coming back ever.
author: Yoyo W.

description: We really enjoyed this restaurant. The spaghetti with puttanesca sauce was fine, as was the fusilli with Gorgonzola sauce. Do not let them put Parmesan on the latter. I should have paid more attention there. All of the non-tomato based sauces were heavy but delicious. We had no room for dessert. The ambience was so pleasant. The restaurant had plenty of customers and yet we could still easily hear one another talk. I will definitely go back.
author: Melissa S.

description:
IMO ....The best richest lasagna in town.

This is a very small simple place .
I happen to like small simple places.
So in the spirit of giving stars for small simple wonderful little places  ...
I give it four stars .

Since I only would come here for the Lasagna I recently decided to try out their specials

 The entree prices for pasta are around $17-22.
Their seafood dishes are at $22 exactly, and very filling and tasty.

The menu is quite nice for this small little 'hole in wall' restaurant.
Love little places like this.

If you like Salmon as I do they will make it with any veges and/or side pasta instead of what is on the printed menu that day because they are just that nice.  Simply ask NICELY !

They have half and full carafes of their house wine that really make dinner a lot more fun...bad Katherine.
$17-half and $24-full.

It's a very simple old word iItalian place with all the Chianti bottles lined up everywhere. 

I always love coming here even if I'm alone because it's feels comfortable and casual plus the service is always so friendly that It's become the place where everyone knows my name .

Eatting at the bar is cool because you get to chat with the owner and the servers who are really chill.

It's small... it's got very good food... it's reasonably priced ... and you can make it casual for 1 or casual for 8 ,  and without a res, because it's not on the radar for super fancy Union Square restaurants .... Remember it  !
author: Katherine N.

description:
L'Ottavo is somewhere between a strong three or a weak four stars.  I wouldn't walk more than seven blocks and I certainly wouldn't drive any distance to eat there.  But since it's only a couple blocks from my place, I go there now and then.  It's a fairly reliable restaurant and I haven't hated anything I've ordered.  

I just had a pretty enjoyable dinner there with Boyfriend and a buddy of ours.  We shared an antipasto platter for two.  I think it was overpriced at about $18.  But I usually feel antipasto is overpriced.  The bread was really good and I love their olive oil with the sun-dried tomatoes.  

Boyfriend ordered Con Pollo E Melanzane but with penne instead of fettuccine.  He liked it but I though the chicken and sauce were both bland.  

Our friend had Fettuccine L'Ottavo.  We all liked this dish and thought the bacon was nicely smoky.

I ordered the Linguine Vongole E Cozze with the white sauce.  There were a ton of mussels and clams and the sauce was great.

In the past we've also liked the Grigliata Mista (mixed grill), Cannelloni Alla Genovese, and Carbonara.
author: Lauren C.

description:
HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE!
A LIVING BUG, OF WHICH I HAVE NEVER SEEEN IN MY LIFE IN THE SALAD! lost my appetite, they offered me a free lobster bisque- was nothing but SALT. HORRIBLE!
then i asked for another bottle of wine instead, but they still charged me. 
spaghetti.. hmmm nothing special. nope, horrible. dont go here. A LIVING BUG! never seen this species of bug before.. EHH i dont even wanna eat food again. DO NOT GO HERE! over priced and not worth your time.
author: Elliott G.

description:
I don't even want to give this place a ONE STAR! The food and service was absolutely horrible! As we thought it couldn't get any worse there is a living cockroach running around in the salad! The waiter came up to us and pretty much didn't even care. As my friend called it, this place is pretty much a "Tourist Trap" in Union Square. 

Walk your asses to North Beach and enjoy a REAL ITALIAN MEAL.
author: sunny c.

description: Very charming place, we'd go back.  Updated now to a 5 star rating.
author: Richard C.

description:
Eh. This place was okay.

Our waiter was also our host. He took his sweet time coming over to take our order. I had time to read the whole menu twice and the specials menu before he came by. Luckily someone else had brought us water by then.

We ordered everything at once: bruschetta appetizer, I had the Chicken Sorrentina hubby had one of the specials that included pasta and a bunch of fish/clams/oysters. We shared a caraffe of the house white wine (good deal).

Overall, hubby enjoyed his meal, mine was okay, wine was good, bruschetta was okay and complimentary bread was good. Service was just okay, so we might go back but odds are we won't. Cute and cozy atmosphere overall.
author: Nancy B.

description: Decent, basic, and honest Italian food. Nothing outlandishly good and nothing outlandishly bad. Fairly priced and quick service.  Go here if you need a predictable, headache-free meal.
author: Alex W.

description: I had the linguine pescatore - very good. My daughter had the penne arabiatta, also good. We split a tiramisu, quite good. The service was a bit brusk. I can't really put my finger on it, but something about the environment was really off. No complaints about the food, but the ticket felt on the high side.
author: Jennie M.

description:
Went for Valentine's Day last night at 7.I have eaten here over the years numerous times because I live close by.
Arrived at 7pm and it was about 1/4 full;. Still no one greeted us. Ok I can get over that. 
Seated. 10 minutes to order wine and 15 to get bread. I do not care about bread so still ok. Ordered from the Regular menu 2 pasta dishes. 
40 minutes to get the food! And then the other waitress brought it out. 
What our waitress was doing I can not say. Not once did she come over to explain or apologize. Really ruined the experience. If a place is super busy or the dish is complicated-OK but this was hardly the case. 
The food itself was pretty good but letting customers wait for 40 minutes without a word is Not acceptable.
author: Susan M.

description: Not sure why this place was so quiet tonight. Nice atmosphere, good service, great food. And reasonably priced. The seafood linguine was excellent. I will be back.
author: David M.

description: Quite possibly the best Italian I have ever had. The only mixup of the evening was that we were given each others plates.
author: Dan L.

description:
YUCK YUCK YUCK!!
awful over priced food. is this homemade Gnocchi...?? I think not.. where the heck is the potato? And this is a special??
